report.title: Awareness on Career Growth Prospects for Reliability Engineering Professionals with Industry Collaborations

description.text: <p>The above workshop has been conducted at the EEE Dept., JNTUACEA (Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Anantapur College of Engineering, Autonomous) STB 12431, as Ananthapuramu Sub-Section event. This workshop has created awareness on broad career opportunities like Reliability Engineer, Quality Control Engineers, Quality Testing Engineers etc. The participants are from the Departments of EEE, ECE, ME&nbsp;and PG Students of the constituent and affiliated colleges of JNTUA. This program is being organized as a twining program with Govt. College of Engineering &amp; Technology, Bikaner, Rajasthan which is a mentee Institution under TEQIP &ndash; III with mentor Institution is JNTUACEA.&nbsp;</p>

report.keywords: Reliability Engineering, Quality Control Engineers, Quality Testing Engineers, Reliability Availability Maintainability Safety
report.cosponsor_name: TEQIP - III, JNTUA CE Ananthapuramu, IEEE ATPSS

topic.title: Reliability Engineering Implementation through Industry-Institute-Interaction Status and some issues seeking Engineering

report.title: Faculty Development Program on Power Converters Design

description.text: <p>The Department of Electrical &amp; Electronics Engineering, JNTUACEA has organised a FDP program on Power Converters Design during 25<sup>th</sup> to 29<sup>th</sup> Sep 2019 which was sponsored by TEQIP-III in association with Pantech ProEd., Chennai. Prof. V. Sankar, Chair IEEE ATPSS and Professor of the Department acted as Convener and Sri. M. Ankarao, Assistant Professor acted as Co-ordinator of the program. The program was inaugurated by Honourable Vice-Chancellor of JNTUA Prof. Srinivas Kumar. The following contents were delivered during 5 days of the program.</p>

report.keywords: Power Converters, ARDUINO, Buck & Boost Converters, Switch Mode Power Supply

topic.title: Introduction to Power Electronics and its applications in Industries
Introduction to ARDUINO Controller and its applications for controlling signals.

description.text: <p>This workshop is expected to create awareness about Smart grid technologies, Load Balancing, Peak Curtailment, Demand Response Support, DG in Electricity Market and Smart Grid Modelling.</p>

report.title: Third Executive Committee Meeting of IEEE Ananthapuramu Subsection Under IEEE Hyderabad Section

report.title: Ananthapuramu Subsection-Three-Day National Workshop

description.text: <p>The IEEE Ananthapuramu Subsection in association with department of Humanities and Social Sciences, JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu, organized a Three-Day National Workshop on &ldquo;Pedagogical Skills for Faculty in Outcome-Based Education&rdquo; from 6-12-2019 to 8-12-2019 on the college premises.&nbsp; The workshop focused on pedagogy methods in higher education order which had undergone revolutionary changes during the last two decades. The traditional strategies have become almost obsolete in current scenario where Outcome-Based Education and student centric teaching learning are the need of the hour. About 120 participants from different parts of the country have participated in this program.</p>

report.keywords: Pedagogical Skills, Outcome based education, JNTUA, Ananthapuramu subsection
report.cosponsor_name: Department of Humanities and Social sciences, JNTUA

topic.title: Pedagogical Skills for enabling Digital Age Learners

report.title: A Webinar on Recent Challenges in Electrical Engineering

description.text: <p>Electrical engineering is a broad field right from power<br />generation to utilization by end users through transmission<br />and distribution. Electrical engineering is always a challenging<br />field which requires a regular up dating with proper control and<br />communication system. Electricity is very useful for mankind<br />since its invention. We are using it in our domestic life and<br />Industries for lighting, Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning,<br />Fans, and to drive Pumps, Compressors etc. With the<br />advancement of technology, increased use of electrical<br />appliances and availability of electrical supply at all the<br />places, it has become complex to supply qualitative power to<br />the consumers safely. This talk aims to review the existing<br />electrical power system, various challenges like increased<br />demand, age old equipment, lack of industry ready manpower,<br />conservation of natural resources, and en-cashing the new<br />opportunities with the help of emerging technologies. Also, an<br />attempt will be made to address the demands and aspirations<br />of various stake holders like power producers &amp; suppliers,<br />consumers, regulators and policy makers.</p>

report.title: A Webinar on ""Scalable End to End Architecture for IoT Applications in Engineering"

description.text: <p>Internet of Things (IoT) devices are used in wide variety of engineering and non-engineering applications.&nbsp; They are used for monitoring Smart Homes, Smart Grids, Mobile Users and even Servers in the Clouds.&nbsp; By nature of their usage, a large amounts of data from a large number of devices is collected, aggregated, stored, processed and visualized.&nbsp; Obviously, the End-to-End architecture of the systems which support IoT applications must be scalable.&nbsp; As the type of applications are varied, there is no universally accepted standard architecture.&nbsp; The proposed talk discusses the common characteristics of IoT applications, identifies important elements involved, discusses the challenges which influence the architecture and describes a scalable architecture along with some of technologies used to support this architecture.</p>

topic.title: Scalable End to End Architecture for IoT Applications in Engineering
